    Class CubicGraph

    Represents a cubic (3-regular) graph, where each vertex has exactly 3 neighbors. This class manages the graph structure, chord lengths, and Hamiltonian cycle.

    Inheritance
    object
    Graph
    CubicGraph

    Constructors

    | Edit this page View Source

    CubicGraph(int[,])

    Initializes a new instance of the CubicGraph class using the provided adjacency matrix.

    Declaration
    public CubicGraph(int[,] adjacencyMatrix)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int[,] adjacencyMatrix

    A square matrix representing the adjacency structure of the graph.
    Remarks

    This constructor ensures that the input graph is cubic at the time of initialization. It also computes the chord lengths for all applicable node pairs and sets the maximum chord length found in the graph.

    Exceptions
    Type Condition
    ArgumentOutOfRangeException

    Thrown if the provided adjacency matrix does not correspond to a valid cubic graph, i.e., each vertex must have exactly three edges.

    HamiltonianCycle

    Stores the Hamiltonian cycle of the graph, represented as a dictionary of vertices and their neighbors in the cycle.

    AddEdge(int, int)

    Adds an edge between two vertices, ensuring the graph remains cubic (3-regular).

    Declaration
    public void AddEdge(int from, int to)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int from

    The starting vertex of the edge.
    int to

    The ending vertex of the edge.
    Exceptions
    Type Condition
    InvalidOperationException

    Thrown if an edge already exists or the degree of a vertex exceeds 3.
